meanings.definition: A small mass of matter of irregular shape
meanings.sent1: She found a lump of clay in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The lump of sugar dissolved in the hot tea.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the lump of yarn, thinking it was a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The lump in her throat made it hard to speak.
meanings.sent5: He felt the lump of ice cream melt in his hand.

meanings.sent1: The lump on his arm turned out to be a harmless cyst.
meanings.sent2: The lump on the tree indicated a termite infestation.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the lump on her head was a new fashion accessory.
meanings.sent4: The lump of dough rose beautifully in the warm kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The lump in the carpet made it difficult to walk smoothly.

meanings.definition: To group together in an indiscriminate manner
meanings.sent1: She would lump all the toys together in one box.
meanings.sent2: Don't lump all the books on the shelf; organize them by genre.
meanings.sent3: He would often lump his socks with his shirts in the laundry.
meanings.sent4: The teacher would lump all the students into one big group for the activity.
meanings.sent5: It's easier to lump all the ingredients for the salad in one bowl.

meanings.sent1: The tired hiker would lump along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The elephant would lump through the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: She would lump around the house in her oversized slippers.
meanings.sent4: The old car would lump down the bumpy road.
meanings.sent5: The heavy suitcase made her lump up the stairs slowly.
